text: Said Akl () or Saïd Akl, Said Aql and Saeed Akl) (4 July 1912 – 28 November 2014) was a Lebanese poet, writer, playwright and language reformer. He was thought to be as one of the most important Lebanese poets of the modern age. He also helped create the Lebanese alphabet. Akl died in Beirut, Lebanon at the age of 102. ==References== ==Other websites== * Poet Said Akl- All Poems * Said Akl's biography Category:1912 births Category:2014 deaths Category:Lebanese poets Category:Centenarians Category:Playwrights
title: Said Akl
